nodes.text: John Swinney : So the worry I have about all of this is that it has that effect that we talked about, Fiona, that Alison talked about in her question, that it essentially undermines public confidence and compliance.
Asserting
the worry John Swinney has about Dominic Cummings' scandal is that it has that effect that Alison talked about in her question, that it essentially undermines public confidence and compliance

Qi: John Swinney : So the worry I have about all of this is that it has that effect that we talked about, Fiona, that Alison talked about in her question, that it essentially undermines public confidence and compliance.
John Swinney : Now this has been a really difficult pandemic for any Government to handle.
Asserting
now the Covid-19 pandemic has been a really difficult pandemic for any Government to handle
Qi: John Swinney : Now this has been a really difficult pandemic for any Government to handle.
Default Transition
John Swinney : It is a challenge for us in the Scottish Government.
Asserting
handling the Covid-19 pandemic is a challenge for us in the Scottish Government
Qi: John Swinney : It is a challenge for us in the Scottish Government.
Default Transition
Default Inference
Arguing

John Swinney : We saw polling information this week which demonstrated very, very high levels of public trust and confidence in the actions of the Scottish Government in how we have handled this crisis.
Asserting
we saw polling information this week which demonstrated very, very high levels of public trust and confidence in the actions of the Scottish Government in how we have handled this crisis

John Swinney :  I worry that the Dominic Cummings fiasco and the arrogance that has been demonstrated by the Prime Minister and by Dominic Cummings and by all of the members of the cabinet in the way that they have expected
